sect2.title: Syntax
sect2.synopsis: <!ELEMENT move (option?, source+, destination)> <!ATTLIST move base CDATA #IMPLIED>
sect2.para: This element occurs in the elements : | |

sect2.title: Description
sect2.para: The element move is one of the many main operation elements. It is used to move one or several source files and/or directories into a destination file or directory.
The sub-element option provides a means to pass an option to the mv command.

note.para: Not all of the cp options are in every implementation. Refer to the documentation for your implementation to determine what options are available.

sect2.para: When processing this element, one moves each source to the destination, using the specified option if present.
The sub-element source contains the name of the directory were the source file is.
The sub-element destination contains the name of the destination directory for the mv command.
The attribute base gives the name of the directory in which the new directory will be created. See .
